nodes.text: The Canary Islands (Spanish: Islas Canarias), located at Coordinates: 28°0′0″N, 16°0′0″W, is a Spanish archipelago in the Atlantic Ocean. Although it is much closer to the African content, or more specifically Morocco, it belongs to Spain and therefore is a part of the European Union. As of 2019, Canary Islands had a population of 2,153,389 and a density of 287.39 inhabitants per km2.

Scenes from Solo: A Star Wars Story, which includes the Cloud-Riders, were filmed in Fuerteventura, one of the islands that make up the archipelago. The in-universe location of Fuerteventura is the planet Savareen.
